intro: Linosyris macrostachya, commonly known as the large-stalked linosyris, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The showy yellow flowers appear in clusters and are accompanied by bracts that give the plant its distinctive appearance.
